meanings.sent1: The long lecture was so boresome that many students fell asleep.
meanings.sent2: Watching paint dry can be quite boresome for some people.
meanings.sent3: The boresome movie made the audience wish they were watching paint dry instead.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive tasks at work became increasingly boresome as the day went on.
meanings.sent5: The boresome weather made the day feel never-ending.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that bores.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the boresome in the group because he always talked about the same topic.
meanings.sent2: The boresome at the party kept everyone from having a good time.
meanings.sent3: The boresome in the office always had a way of making meetings drag on.
meanings.sent4: The boresome of the class made even the most interesting subjects seem dull.
meanings.sent5: Avoiding the boresome at social gatherings became a skill for many.
